Constructor Detail

Laserschein

public Laserschein(processing.core.PApplet theParent)
Inits the library "Processing style"

Parameters:
theParent - the main Processing applet. Almost anytime: this

Laserschein

public Laserschein(processing.core.PApplet theParent,
                   java.lang.String theOutputClassName)
Lets you choose what output module should be used for the laser output. Currently supported are "LD2000" and "Easylase"

Parameters:
theParent - Your PApplet
theOutputClassName - Name of the output module
See Also:
Laserschein()

Laserschein

public Laserschein(processing.core.PApplet theParent,
                   java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractLaserOutput> theOutputClass)
Init the library and the output module directly. Accepts a class, so you could write your own output module

Parameters:
theParent - Your PApplet
theOutputClass - The class: e.g. LD2000Adaptor.class

renderer

public Laser3D renderer()
Get the renderer that processing can use with beginRaw() and endRaw(). So one can draw stuff on the laser with the processing syntax.

Returns:
a reference to the renderer

getRenderer

public Laser3D getRenderer()
Same as renderer()
